title: Multidimensional Mathematics Instructional Design in Distance Education: Integrating Cognitivism, Behaviorism, Social Constructivism, and Connectivism

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental secondary mathematics concepts and basic problem-solving experience in specialized fields (medical/legal/technical)
context.additional_context: A course for medical/legal/technical experts to explore effective remote teaching methods for primary/secondary mathematics education, providing practical problem-solving scenarios via VR simulation

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze mathematical problem-solving steps by applying a cognitive-behavioral approach in VR-based simulations
Learners can perform mathematical concept modeling based on social constructivist principles using collaborative tools
Learners can design connectivist learning pathways that link digital network resources to solve real-world mathematical problems in professional contexts
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
